The claim was made on Twitter on Februar: 2020, stating that COVID-19 stands for "China Outbreak Virus in December 19."
Similar claims were shared on various so: including Twitter, Instagram, Reddit, and Facebook.
The World Health Organization: WHO) announced that COVID-19 stands for "coronavirus disease 2019" and not "China Outbreak Virus in December 19."
The WHO provided a detailed explanation: stating that "CO" stands for corona, "VI" stands for virus, and "D" stands for disease, making it "COVID." The name was chosen to avoid geographical, animal, or individual references and to be easily pronounceable and related to the disease.
